etymology.description: 亼(亼) (jí, "assemble") over a pictographic bowl of rice on a stand, symbolized by 𠊊(𠊊) (jí, "bowl with stand")
etymology.interpretation: Initially, the character 食(食) (shí, "eat") visually represented a mouth over a bowl of rice, conveying the act of eating or a meal intuitively through this imagery.

examples.chinese: 他食得很快(他食得很快)。
我准备午食(我準備午食)，与朋友共享佳肴(與朋友共享佳餚)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ zhǔnbèi wǔ shí, yǔ péngyǒu gòngxiǎng jiāyáo.
examples.english: I am preparing lunch to share a delicious meal with my friends.

examples.chinese: 民以食为天(民以食為天)。
examples.english: Food is regarded as the most important element for the people.
